page.title: 11The Jumbles
page.content: The Jumbles Country Park was opened in 1971 by the N.W.Water Authority.It covers 77 acres of land,55 acres of which are water. The reservoir is southernmost in the Bradshaw Brook Valley,linking with Wayoh and Entwistle reservoirs.The sole purpose of the reservoir is to regulate the flow of water in that part of Bradshaw Brook lying south of the embankment.It is a compensation reservoir ,it is not used for drinking water. The water is used for recreational purposes.It is stocked with coarse fish and is used for sailing and canoeing.It cannot be used for swimming because of the cold and the depth of the water(sixty five feet). A section of the water has been designated a Nature Conservation Area. Here birds are able to breed
